name: 9H-Xanthen-9-ol
Reason: 9H-Xanthen-9-ol has a melting point that we can compare to by analyzing its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison can be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of two additional phenyl groups and a methoxy group increases the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, which can further lower the melting point. The xanthene ring formation introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5.
